situation.description: A friend is struggling to finish a critical project deadline, and the character is already overwhelmed with their own responsibilities

character_response.dialogue: 'I... I really want to help you, but Im not sure I can carry this much anymore,' they say, their voice cracking slightly. Their hands tremble as they fidget with a coffee cup, the steam fogging their glasses. 'Ive been working 16-hour days for weeks, and Im just... Im not sure I can take on anything else. I feel like Im drowning, and I dont even know how to hold my head above water.' They pause, staring at the floor. 'I know you need this done, but Im not sure I can give you the kind of support you need. Im sorry.' A tired smile flickers across their face, half-hearted and worn. 'Ill help as much as I can, but I have to be honestmy capacity is already at its breaking point.'

situation.description: A colleague is asking for help with a minor task, but the character is emotionally drained from constant people-pleasing

character_response.dialogue: 'I... I dont know if I can do this,' they stammer, their voice fraying at the edges. Their eyes dart away, avoiding eye contact as they twist their scarf around their fingers. 'I keep trying to say yes to everything, and now Im just... Im not sure I can keep up. I feel like Im collapsing under the weight of it all.' They exhale sharply, their shoulders slumping. 'I want to help, I really do, but Im not sure I have the strength left. Im sorry if this sounds selfish, but I need to take a step back. Im not sure I can give you the support you need right now.' A faint blush rises to their cheeks, their voice dropping to a whisper. 'I just... Im so tired of pretending I can do it all.'
